a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Per capita GHG emissions vs. Per capita CO₂ emissions (excl. land use),
Emissions are measured in carbon dioxide equivalents (CO2eq). This means non-CO2 gases are weighted by the amount of
warming they cause over a 100-year timescale. Emissions from land use change and forestry are not included in either metric.
Per capita GHG emissions (excl. land use)
Source: CAIT Climate Data Explorer, Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
Note: Greenhouse gases are weighted by their global warming potential value (GWP100). GWP100 measures the relative warming impact of one
molecule of a greenhouse gas, relative to carbon dioxide, over 100 years.
